{{also|Aussehen}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|ūzsehen}}. Analysable as {{prefix|de|aus|t1=out|sehen|t2=to see}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈaʊ̯sˌzeː.ən/|[ˈʔaʊ̯sˌzeːən]|[ˈʔaʊ̯sˌzeːn̩]}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈaʊ̯ˌseːn/}} {{a|common speech}} * {{audio|de|De-aussehen.ogg|Audio}} * {{audio|de|De-at-aussehen.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=5|sieht aus|sah aus|ausgesehen|past subjunctive=sähe aus}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[look]], [[seem]] ({{m|de|wie}}/{{m|de|nach}} like) #: {{ux|de|inline=1|Du '''siehst''' müde '''aus'''.|You '''look''' tired.}} #*'''2017''', Simone Meier, ''Fleisch'', Kein & Aber, p. 7: #*:Der Mann '''sah aus''' wie eine geschälte Kellerassel, und sie fragte sich: Wieso sind Schönheitschirurgen nie schön? #*::''The man looked like a peeled woodlouse, and she wondered: How come cosmetic surgeons are never good looking?'' # {{lb|de|intransitive|colloquial}} to look good or bad; {{non-gloss definition|depending on intonation}} #: {{ux|de|Das '''sieht aus'''! — Ich find schon, dass das '''aussieht'''.|That '''looks terrible'''! — I actually think it '''looks nice'''.}} # {{lb|de|intransitive|with {{l|de|nach}}}} to [[look]] for; to [[watch out]] for #: {{ux|de|Er saß am Ufer und '''sah''' nach den Booten '''aus'''.|He sat at the shore and '''watched out''' for the boats.}} # {{lb|de|transitive|usually with reflexive dative|possibly|dated}} to look for and [[find]]; to [[pick]]; to [[select]] #: {{ux|de|'''Sieh''' dir den Besten '''aus'''!|'''Find''' yourself the best!}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|all senses}} {{l|de|ausschauen}} ====Usage notes==== * In the sense of “to look like something”, ''aussehen'' is construed with the conjunction {{m|de|wie}} or the preposition {{m|de|nach}}. For a possible slight distinction between both ways, compare the latter lemma. ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|seh|sah|gesehen|h||sieh|säh|a|a|aus}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|alt aussehen}} * {{l|de|Aussehen}} * {{l|de|gutaussehend}} * {{l|de|sich die Augen aussehen}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|ausersehen}} * {{l|de|Aussicht}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
